Description.val:
The Naval Tactical Command Support System (NTCSS) is the logistics information system which enables combat lethality by generating and sustaining Navy and Marine Corps force materiel readiness for operational commanders afloat and ashore.  NTCSS provides organizational maintenance management capabilities for all afloat and ashore operational forces (ships, submarines, expeditionary, and cyber), as well as organizational and intermediate maintenance management to maintain operational availability of deployed and deployable aircraft.  NTCSS also provides personnel administration capabilities, planning and execution of warehouse and inventory management functions for repair parts and consumable material, financial accountability thereof, and support services of food and afloat retail point-of-sale operations.  NTCSS system upgrades procures afloat and ashore ruggedized, commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) computing equipment, which includes servers to support the NTCSS application and database, personal computers (PCs) that will interface with the servers for maintenance and supply transactions, and printers to display output.  COTS software, which includes the operating system, comes loaded on the servers and PCs.


Naval Operational Business Logistics Enterprise (NOBLE) family of systems will provide direct support to warfighter readiness with maintenance, supply, and personnel administration capabilities using an open architecture framework that incorporates business process re-engineering (BPR) allowing for the consolidation of standalone application systems.  These capabilities include enterprise-wide automation of supply, inventory, and financial functions to the Naval supply system, aviation maintenance support capability that services all levels of aviation maintenance (organizational, intermediate, and depot) for over 2,100 Navy and Marine Corps aircraft, standardized operational business processes for afloat maritime maintenance activities to all naval ships, and Navy-wide personnel and administration data sharing across shipboard and shore-based information systems.  NOBLE will meet current and emerging  demands for cyber, Financial Improvement and Audit Readiness (FIAR), and Navy logistics and maritime maintenance  mission requirements.  NOBLE initial fielding procures afloat and ashore ruggedized, commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) computing equipment, which includes servers to support the NOBLE application and database, personal computers (PCs) that will interface with the servers for maintenance and supply transactions, and printers to display output.  COTS software, which includes the operating system, comes loaded on the servers and PCs.

Justification.val: Funding for FY 2021 procures:  1) NTCSS system upgrades for ships; 2) NTCSS system upgrades for Naval Air Stations (NAS), Squadrons, Shore Support Facilities, Fleet Training Centers, Marine Aviation Logistics Squadrons (MALS), Navy Expeditionary Combat Command sites, Special Warfare units, and Commander Naval Surface Forces; 3) NOBLE system initial fielding for Naval Air Squadrons, Marine Aviation Logistics Squadrons (MALS), Navy Expeditionary Combat Command sites, and Special Warfare units; and 4) necessary production engineering and installation support.

Name.val: NTCSS and NOBLE Ship Set Equipment Upgrades

Remarks.val:
Provides ADP system upgrades and NTCSS-Optimized software to Battle Group and unit level ships.

Application subsystems include financial/inventory management, organizational and surface maintenance management, and administrative information systems support.  NTCSS procurements will also provide ship capabilities for displaying and storing Computer-aided Acquisition and Logistics Support (CALS) initiative information (digitized engineering drawings, automated technical manuals, etc.).

[Flyaway] NOBLE will be fielded at program-of-record (POR) afloat and ashore sites. Ship set and MALS/Shore equipment upgrades continue; hardware and software upgrades required for obsolescence avoidance.

Provides ADP system upgrades and NOBLE software to force level and unit level ships.

NOBLE MALS/Shore Equipment Upgrades (DY996): Quantity changes from year to year are driven by fact-of-life changes to ashore site availability schedules. The variance in unit cost between fiscal years is attributed to the composition of ashore site configurations that NOBLE will be procuring and installing in any given fiscal year.

Name.@footnote: Quantity changes from year to year are driven by fact-of-life changes to ship maintenance availability schedules.  The average unit cost fluctuation is primarily attributed to variance in system configuration requirements for each NTCSS platform type. In FY21, NTCSS transitions to a CANES hosted environment. The unit cost represents the cost of software licenses, as well as hardware for non-CANES platforms.

Quantity changes from year to year are driven by fact-of-life changes to ship maintenance availability schedules. The average unit cost fluctuation is primarily attributed to variance in system configuration requirements for each NOBLE platform type. NOBLE Afloat fielding is scheduled to commence in FY21.

For 2.1.2 MALS/Shore Equipment Upgrades in FY21, the unit cost of $233.571K is based on upgrading the Virtual Environment(VE) h/w configuration at the seven (7) MALS sites, which is the central hosting element supporting up to 25 squadrons. Whereas in FY20, the unit cost of $66.720K supported refreshing the individual squadron's deployment h/w configuration.

In FY21, the scope of installation increases in support of fielding NTCSS 4.40, which adds Food Service Management (FSM) and Retail Operation Management (ROM) software programs into the NTCSS Family of Systems.

ModificationTitle.val: Naval Tactical Command Support System MALS/Shore Equipment Upgrades (DY006)

Model.val: Provides ADP system upgrades and NTCSS-Optimized software to force level and unit level ships.

Title.val: Naval Tactical Command Support System MALS/Shore Equipment Upgrades (DY006)

Name.@footnote: Quantity changes from year to year are driven by fact-of-life changes to ashore site availability schedules.  The variance in unit cost between fiscal years is attributed to the composition of ashore site configurations (Non-VE versus large NAS/MALS fielding) that NTCSS will be procuring and installing in any given fiscal year.

Description.val: NTCSS-Optimized software will continue to be fielded at program-of-record (POR) afloat and ashore sites.  Ship set and MALS/Shore equipment upgrades continue; hardware and software upgrades required for obsolescence avoidance.
